title: Slideshow: Special Topics in Psychology: Working Memory
text:
Topic: Working Memory
The Article:

Allen, RJ, Havelka, J, Falcon, T et al, Modality specificity and integration in working memory Insights from visuospatial bootstrapping,

Link to Article Text Article on the web

title: Slideshow: Special Topics in Psychology: Working Memory
text:
Question
Broad Question: How meaningful associations between verbal and spatial information might be utilized to facilitate working memory performance

title: Slideshow: Special Topics in Psychology: Working Memory
text:
REFERENCES
Allen, RJ, Havelka, J, Falcon, T et al. (2 more authors) (2014) Modality specificity and integration in working memory: Insights from visuospatial bootstrapping. Journal of Experimental Psychology: Learning, Memory, and Cognition. ISSN 1939-1285 https://doi.org/10.1037/xlm0000058

title: Slideshow: Special Topics in Psychology: Working Memory
text:
Question
Specific Question: The present study explored how separable processing capacities within
specialized domains might each contribute to meaningful associations between verbal and spatial information, by examining the disruptive impacts of simple verbal and spatial concurrent tasks on young adults’ recall of visually presented digit sequences encountered either in a single location or within a meaningful spatial “keypad” configuration
